snippet: As rebuilding lags, the showcase project of reconstruction is an industrial park in an undamaged area, a venture that risks benefiting foreign companies more than Haiti itself.
abstract: Haiti remains mired in a humanitarian crisis two and a half years after the earthquake, with 390,000 people languishing in tents; as rebuilding lags, the showcase project of the reconstruction effort is Caracol Industrial Park that is supposed to create jobs and housing in an undamaged area, but the venture risks benefiting foreign companies more than Haiti itself.

byline.contributor: Kara Andrade contributed reporting from Guatemala, and Brent McDonald and André Paultre from Haiti.

lead_paragraph: As rebuilding lags, the showcase project of reconstruction is an industrial park in an undamaged area, a venture that risks benefiting foreign companies more than Haiti itself.

headline.main: Earthquake Relief Where Haiti Wasn’t Broken
headline.print_headline: Earthquake Relief Where Haiti Wasn’t Broken
